name: CSS-style overrides
format:
<style>

/* These style overrides assume the "Dark Theme" is being used */

/*
Used for dynamically amending menu/tab items
:root {
    --main-color: "blue";
}
[aria-label~="Your tab Name"] {
    background-color: var(--main-color,green);
}

[aria-label~="Home"] + div > p::after {
    content: 'woot' ;
*/

body.nr-dashboard-theme {
 background-color: #333333;
 font-family: Calibri;
}
button, html, input, select, textarea {
 font-family: Calibri;
}
body.nr-dashboard-theme md-content md-card {
 background-color: #33333300;
 color: #d0d0d0;
}

body.nr-dashboard-theme md-toolbar {
 background-image: linear-gradient(to right, #404040, #737373);
 box-shadow: 0px 1px 20px #0000008a;
}
.nr-dashboard-theme ui-card-panel {
 background-image: linear-gradient(to bottom right, #404040, #737373);
 border: 1px solid #555555;
 box-shadow: 0 0 20px #00000066;
}

.nr-dashboard-theme ui-card-panel p.nr-dashboard-cardtitle {
 color: #2eb82e;
 text-shadow: 0 0 2px black;
}

.nr-dashboard-theme .nr-dashboard-form-button {
 background-image: linear-gradient(to bottom right, #8a8a8a6e, #00000070);
 background-color: #00ad03;
 color: #d0d0d0;
 text-shadow: 0 0 2px #525252;
 border-radius:6px;
}

.nr-dashboard-theme .nr-dashboard-button .md-button {
 background-image: linear-gradient(to bottom right, #8a8a8a6e, #00000070);
 background-color: #00ad03;
 color: #d0d0d0;
 text-shadow: 0 0 2px #525252;
 border-radius:6px;
}
.nr-dashboard-theme .nr-dashboard-button .md-button:hover {
 background-color: #00de00;
}

.nr-dashboard-theme .nr-dashboard-switch md-switch .md-thumb {
 background-image: linear-gradient(to bottom right, #48b349, #115009);
}
.nr-dashboard-button .md-button {
 box-shadow: 0 1px 3px 0 rgba(0,0,0,.26)!important;
 width: 100%!important;
 height: 100%!important;
 margin: 0!important;
 min-width: 0!important;
 min-height: 0!important;
}
.nr-dashboard-theme .nr-dashboard-slider .md-thumb:after {
 background-image: linear-gradient(to bottom right, #48b349, #115009);
 border-style: none;
}
.nr-dashboard-theme .nr-dashboard-numeric .value {
 background-color: #33333300;
 color:#d0d0d0;
}

.nr-dashboard-numeric .value {
 font-weight: 700;
 text-align: center;
 border: 0;
}

.nr-dashboard-form {
 display: inline-block;
 width: 100%;
 overflow-y: visible;
}
#SETTINGS_TEATED_cards {
 min-height: 260px;
}

</style>
info:
CSS Style overrides to the Node-RED Dark theme.

From the Dashboard node information panel (View->Dashboard), select
 - Site: Options -> Node-RED theme everywhere
 - Theme: Style -> Dark

payload: [{"2 Pounds Force":"Please use a MAX of 2 pounds of force! If something is meant to move, it will move easily!"},{"How dare you":"How dare you disturb my tomb! Look at me! You have now sealed your fate."},{"Search the room":"Standard escape room practice. Look On, Around, and Under things"},{"Discourage cell phones":"Using your phones takes away from the experience. Humor me, use the lantern"},{"Back of tomb door":"Try looking behind the door you entered through"},{"Simple Calculation":"Do one Simple Calculation on the Note"},{"Switch Template":"I think you need a template to reveal the correct switch order."},{"Template Arrows":"Try aligning the template over the arrows to show the correct switch order"},{"Pressing too long":"You are sometimes holding down the tile/button too long."},{"Simon Red Flash":"The whole floor red flash and buzzer means fail or game reseting because time expired"},{"Simon":"Allow sequence to complete before attempting to repeat. Sequence starts with a single flash then gets progressively longer"},{"Simon single player":"You may be better off playing with a single player pressing tiles"},{"Simon Explicit":"Do as Simon Says. Example: If the tiles flash yellow once, repeat the pattern by pressing once on the the yellow tile row. The sequence will get progressively longer."},{"Assign a leader":" Work together! The chaos is hindering your progress"},{"Stop stepping on tiles":"Work together! People are randomly stepping on tiles"},{"Decoder buttons":"The Black Tiles are buttons. The buttons must be pressed in a specific order"},{"Decoder buttons explicit":"The Black Tiles are buttons. The buttons must be pressed in a specific order. The symbols dictate the order"},{"Decoder basic":"Use the map of the floor to decode the symbols"},{"Back of map":"Look at the back of the map for clarity"},{"Decode the Obelisk":"The correct placement will be revealed when you decode the Obelisk!"},{"Decoded 1 side":"You have only decoded 1 of the sides of the center Obelisk!"},{"More symbols":"You have more symbols to decode"},{"Decode the Relics Basic":"You must decode your offerings before the Gods will accept them"},{"Relics What Color?":"What did you see when you decoded each Offering?"},{"Match Relics Color with God":"You must match each offering with it's God"},{"Decode Explicit":"Use the map to decode the symbols. Decode from left to right, OR from top to bottom. Enter the sequence of symbols using the floor tiles as buttons. Example: One side of column has 4 symbols. Enter the symbols in order 1 at a time using the black tiles buttons. Do not hold down the buttons"},{"Another Combo":"Your path to Escape is still blocked by at least one unopened combo lock"},{"Split up":"If you hope to have any chance at Escaping, Split up! You have more than 1 puzzle to solve."},{"Combo Hint?":"If you would like a hint for the Wooden tile puzzle, press the hint button"},{"Combo Average":"Wooden tile puzzle.  Average is your key."},{"Combo Average Explicit":"Wooden tile puzzle.  Average of each tiles perimeter. You have 2 completed examples"},{"Combo order":"Wooden tile puzzle.  Ensure that the wooden tiles are properly placed in the tray. It may help to remove them from the tray and start over."},{"Chicklet Hint?":"If you would like a hint for the Sliding Tile Puzzle, press the hint button"},{"Chicklet":"Sliding tile puzzle: Solve the top row first then don't disturb. Then solve left row and don't disturb."},{"Bypass Chicklet Puzzle?":"If you want to bypass the sliding tile puzzle, press the hint button"},{"Search the room":"Standard escape room practice. Look On, Around, and Under things"},{"Small Box combo":"The 3 digit combo you are looking for is 042"},{"Respect set":"The set is delicate! Please be respectful of the set!"}]

rules.to: Just a reminder that hints are available. Just press the HINT button

name: Top
payload: [{"2 Pounds Force":"Please use a MAX of 2 pounds of force! If something is meant to move, it will move easily!"},{"Sound for hint showing":"The sound you just heard is for when a new hint or suggestion is shown on this screen. It is not suggesting you ask for a hint."},{"2 clues in room":"Try looking under the small shelf, AND also on the back of the drawer for clues"},{"Need 1 more block ":"More letters would be nice. Go back and search it twice"},{"Leftmost bookshelf ":"Try searching the leftmost bookshelf, lower half"},{"Search the room":"Standard escape room practice. Look On, Around, and Under things"},{"Computer Hint*":"On the Archives computer, Forgot PIN, press the * key"},{"Archive Hint screen":"For your information, there is a monitor at the far end of the Archives which also displays the hints and time remaining"},{"Archive 5 digit":"Do you notice anything different about the archives keypad screen?"},{"One is not a direction":"One is not a Direction"},{"5 capitalized directions":"Try looking for 5 capitalized directions in Rita's note, the first is Right. Then reflect upon the map with your solution"},{"R, D, R, D, U Explicit":"Right, Down, Right, Down ,Up - from the note. The reflect upon the map with your solution to get a 5 digit pin #"},{"Directions":"The DIRECTIONS that you need are in the words you did read in Rita's note"},{"Map Reflect":"Try reflecting upon the map with your solution"},{"Key no Longer needed":"The key is no longer in play"},{"Door Sign With Door":"Please heed the sign on the door"},{"Door Sign With Door and Key":"Please heed the sign on the door you used the Key on"},{"Door sign polite":"The polite suggestion is the other sign on door"},{"Close door behind you Explicit":"Please enter the small room and close door behind you to reveal the order"},{"Smiley face":"The smiley face is relevant"},{"Senet Order subtle":"The symbols on the wall don't face the same directions as those on the pieces"},{"Senet Drawer":"Check inside the drawer under the Senet game for clarity"},{"Opposite of Right":"What is Opposite of Right?"},{"Heed the Senet":"Please don't direspect your opponent"},{"Senet order Explicit":"Place the Senet pieces accurately in their pockets at the back of the board in order from left to right. The most powerful piece goes on the left."},{"Senet first move Maze Explicit":"Move the Most Powerful Piece on the board by sliding towards you. Do not lift piece from board as that is a show of disrespect for your opponent"},{"Senet solve Maze Explicit":"When you properly move the Most Powerful Piece on the board by slowly sliding towards you, look under it and see the ball. Move the ball thru the maze to the lower right of the board"},{"Numbers are not Symbols":"Numbers are not Symbols"},{"Respect set":"The set is delicate! Please be respectful of the set!"}]

$boolean(arg)
func:
// $boolean(arg)

/*
Argument type	    Result
Boolean	            unchanged
string: empty	    false
string: non-empty	true
number: 0	        false
number: non-zero	true
null	            false
array: empty	    false
array: any true	    true
array: all false	false
object: empty	    false
object: non-empty	true
function	        false
*/

const data = {
    example: [
    true,
    false,
    "",
    "Hello world",
    0,
    1,
    null,
    [],
    [ false, true ],
    [false],
    {},
    { "non": "empty" },
    function test() { return; },
    ],
};

// Casts the argument to a Boolean
const expression = [
    jsonata("$boolean(example[0])"),
    jsonata("$boolean(example[1])"),
    jsonata("$boolean(example[2])"),
    jsonata("$boolean(example[3])"),
    jsonata("$boolean(example[4])"),
    jsonata("$boolean(example[5])"),
    jsonata("$boolean(example[6])"),
    jsonata("$boolean(example[7])"),
    jsonata("$boolean(example[8])"),
    jsonata("$boolean(example[9])"),
    jsonata("$boolean(example[10])"),
    jsonata("$boolean(example[11])"),
    jsonata("$boolean(example[12])"),
];

msg.payload = [
    expression[0].evaluate(data),
    expression[1].evaluate(data),
    expression[2].evaluate(data),
    expression[3].evaluate(data),
    expression[4].evaluate(data),
    expression[5].evaluate(data),
    expression[6].evaluate(data),
    expression[7].evaluate(data),
    expression[8].evaluate(data),
    expression[9].evaluate(data),
    expression[10].evaluate(data),
    expression[11].evaluate(data),
    expression[12].evaluate(data),
];

return msg;

name: $not(arg)
func:
// $not(arg)

/*
Argument type	    Result
Boolean	            opposite
string: empty	    true
string: non-empty	false
number: 0	        true
number: non-zero	false
null	            true
array: empty	    true
array: any true	    false
array: all false	true
object: empty	    true
object: non-empty	false
function	        true
*/

const data = {
    example: [
    true,
    false,
    "",
    "Hello world",
    0,
    1,
    null,
    [],
    [ false, true ],
    [false],
    {},
    { "non": "empty" },
    function test() { return; },
    ],
};

// Returns Boolean NOT on the argument, the revese of $boolean()
const expression = [
    jsonata("$not(example[0])"),
    jsonata("$not(example[1])"),
    jsonata("$not(example[2])"),
    jsonata("$not(example[3])"),
    jsonata("$not(example[4])"),
    jsonata("$not(example[5])"),
    jsonata("$not(example[6])"),
    jsonata("$not(example[7])"),
    jsonata("$not(example[8])"),
    jsonata("$not(example[9])"),
    jsonata("$not(example[10])"),
    jsonata("$not(example[11])"),
    jsonata("$not(example[12])"),
];

msg.payload = [
    expression[0].evaluate(data),
    expression[1].evaluate(data),
    expression[2].evaluate(data),
    expression[3].evaluate(data),
    expression[4].evaluate(data),
    expression[5].evaluate(data),
    expression[6].evaluate(data),
    expression[7].evaluate(data),
    expression[8].evaluate(data),
    expression[9].evaluate(data),
    expression[10].evaluate(data),
    expression[11].evaluate(data),
    expression[12].evaluate(data),
];

return msg;

name: $exists(arg)
func:
// $exists(arg)

const data = {
    example: [
    true,
    false,
    "",
    "Hello world",
    0,
    1,
    null,
    [],
    [ false, true ],
    [false],
    {},
    { "non": "empty" },
    function test() { return; },
    ],
};

// Returns Boolean, true if the arg expression evaluates to a value
// or false if the expression does not match anything
const expression = [
    jsonata("$exists(example[0])"),
    jsonata("$exists(example[1])"),
    jsonata("$exists(example[2])"),
    jsonata("$exists(example[3])"),
    jsonata("$exists(example[4])"),
    jsonata("$exists(example[5])"),
    jsonata("$exists(example[6])"),
    jsonata("$exists(example[7])"),
    jsonata("$exists(example[8])"),
    jsonata("$exists(example[9])"),
    jsonata("$exists(example[10])"),
    jsonata("$exists(example[11])"),
    jsonata("$exists(example[12])"),
];

msg.payload = [
    expression[0].evaluate(data),
    expression[1].evaluate(data),
    expression[2].evaluate(data),
    expression[3].evaluate(data),
    expression[4].evaluate(data),
    expression[5].evaluate(data),
    expression[6].evaluate(data),
    expression[7].evaluate(data),
    expression[8].evaluate(data),
    expression[9].evaluate(data),
    expression[10].evaluate(data),
    expression[11].evaluate(data),
    expression[12].evaluate(data),
];

return msg;

name: $count(arr)

$sort(arr, fun)
$reverse(arr)
$shuffle(arr)
$distinct(arr)
$zip(arr1, ...)
$now()
$millis()
$fromMillis(num, pic, tim)
$toMillis(tim, pic)
$map(arr, fun)
$filter(arr, fun)
$single(arr, fun)
$reduce(arr, fun, ini)
$keys(obj)
$lookup(obj, key)
$spread(obj)
$merge([obj])
$type(val)
$sift(obj, fun)
$each(obj, fun)
$error(mes)
$assert(con, mes)
This flow requires the npm module jsonata
info:
run 'npm i jsonata' from your .node-red directory
and set functionExternalModules to true in your settings.js file
